LicensesÂ¶

OpenMDAO is being released under the Apache License, Version 2.0, which has been approved by the Open Source Initiative OSI). The text of this license can be found here.

The following table provides a list of the distributions that are currently being used by the OpenMDAO framework as well as the version, type of license, and a link for obtaining more information for each distribution.

Note

The links in the table that follows are generated from each distribution’s metadata, so in some cases, a link may be out of date and you might be redirected to another URL.

Distribs Used by OpenMDAO Version License Link
bson 0.3.3 BSD http://github.com/martinkou/bson
cobyla 1.0.2 permissive open source http://www.pyopt.org
conmin 1.0.2 public domain http://www.scilab.org/contrib/index_contrib.php?page=displayContribution&fileID=1086
decorator 3.4.0 BSD License http://pypi.python.org/pypi/decorator
docutils 0.10 public domain, Python, 2-Clause BSD, GPL 3 (see COPYING.txt) http://docutils.sourceforge.net/
Jinja2 2.4 BSD http://jinja.pocoo.org/
mock 1.0.1 UNKNOWN http://www.voidspace.org.uk/python/mock/
networkx 1.9.1 BSD http://networkx.github.io/
newsumt 1.1.1 public domain http://ntrs.nasa.gov/archive/nasa/casi.ntrs.nasa.gov/19790018640_1979018640.pdf
nose 1.3.3 GNU LGPL http://readthedocs.org/docs/nose/
numpy 1.8.1 BSD http://www.numpy.org
openmdao.lib 0.13.0 Apache License, Version 2.0 http://openmdao.org
openmdao.main 0.13.0 Apache License, Version 2.0 http://openmdao.org
openmdao.test 0.13.0 Apache License, Version 2.0 http://openmdao.org
openmdao.units 0.13.0 CeCILL-C http://openmdao.org
openmdao.util 0.13.0 Apache License, Version 2.0 http://openmdao.org
pycrypto 2.3 UNKNOWN http://www.pycrypto.org/
Pyevolve 0.6 PSF http://pyevolve.sourceforge.net/
Pygments 1.3.1 BSD License http://pygments.org/
pyparsing 1.5.7 MIT License http://pyparsing.wikispaces.com/
pytz 2014.4 MIT http://pythonhosted.org/pytz
requests 2.2.1 Copyright 2014 Kenneth Reitz http://python-requests.org
scipy 0.13.3 BSD http://www.scipy.org
setuptools 0.9.5 PSF or ZPL https://pypi.python.org/pypi/setuptools
slsqp 1.0.2 permissive open source http://www.pyopt.org
Sphinx 1.2.2 BSD http://sphinx-doc.org/
traits 4.3.0 BSD http://code.enthought.com/projects/traits
zope.interface 3.6.1 ZPL 2.1 http://pypi.python.org/pypi/zope.interface
Links to the OS licenses mentioned above:
  • OSI Approved, BSD
  • CeCILL-C
  • OSI Approved, GNU Lesser General Public License (LGPL)
  • OSI Approved, MIT
  • Python 2.2.1
  • OSI Approved, Python Software Foundation (PSF)
  • OSI Approved, Zope Public License (ZPL)
